meanings.definition: To not assign a rating or value to something.
meanings.sent1: She decided to unrate the movie because she couldn't decide if it was good or bad.
meanings.sent2: The teacher asked the students to unrate the importance of each item on the list.
meanings.sent3: After the mix-up, they had to unrate all the products and start over.
meanings.sent4: The artist chose to unrate their own work to let the viewers interpret it freely.
meanings.sent5: The app allows users to unrate the songs they don't like, creating a personalized playlist.

meanings.definition: To remove a rating or value from something.
meanings.sent1: He had to unrate the seller's credibility after finding out about the fake reviews.
meanings.sent2: The company decided to unrate the old products to make room for new ones.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick was so unbelievable that it made the audience unrate all other performances.
meanings.sent4: The storm's destruction seemed to unrate the beauty of the once picturesque town.
meanings.sent5: The decision to unrate the restaurant's hygiene caused a stir among the regular customers.
